org.sliderule.stats

Class ChiSquared

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sliderule.stats.ChiSquared

  • public final class ChiSquared
extends java.lang.Object

    Χ² Distribution

    This class provides a time-efficient means for querying values and inverse values from the cumulative distribution function (CDF) for the Chi-Squared distribution. Also provided is a method to determine the minimum number of samples required, from a Normal random variable, for a given confidence level in determining that it is normally distributed. Lastly, a method is provided to test(double, org.sliderule.stats.Histogram, org.sliderule.stats.Histogram) data for goodness of fit to a particular distribution - i.e. to perform a Χ² test

    See Also:
    • Wikipedia: Student's t-distribution
    • DeGroot, Morris H., and Schervish, Mark J. Probability and Statistics, 3rd Edition. Toronto: Addison-Wesley, 2002. pp. 393-404, 776-777. Print.

    • Method Detail

      • cdf

        public static double cdf(int n,
         double x)
        Evaluate the cumulative distribution function of the ChiSquared distribution.
        Parameters:
        n - sample size such that there are n-1 degrees of freedom. 2 <= n
        x - value of random variable X
        Returns:
        p = Pr( X <= x | n-1 )

      • inv

        public static double inv(int n,
         double p)
        Evaluate the inverse of the cumulative distribution function of the ChiSquared distribution.
        Parameters:
        n - sample size such that there are n-1 degrees of freedom.2 <= n
        p - level of confidence. 0 <= p <= 1
        Returns:
        x ∋ Pr( X <= x | n-1 ) = p

      • minSamples

        public static int minSamples(double q,
             double p)

      • test

        public static boolean test(double p,
           Histogram prototype,
           Histogram hypothesis)
        Perform a Χ² test to determine if the sampled values, h, are a good fit for the prototypical distribution, proto. The null hypothesis is that the distribution is not a good fit.
        Parameters:
        prototype - a reference distribution of the random variable X
        hypothesis - data sampled from the random variable X
        p - the confidence level the test must satisfy. 0 < p < 1
        Returns:
        true if the null hypothesis is invalid - i.e. if prototype is a good fit for h
